meanings.definition: To strip of possessions or value
meanings.sent1: The thieves despoiled the house of all its valuables.
meanings.sent2: The invaders despoiled the village of its riches.
meanings.sent3: The raccoons despoiled the picnic basket of all its goodies.
meanings.sent4: The storm despoiled the garden of its beauty.
meanings.sent5: The vandals despoiled the museum of its priceless artifacts.

meanings.sent1: The pirates despoiled the merchant ships of their cargo.
meanings.sent2: The bandits despoiled the travelers of their belongings.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoons despoiled the campsite of all the snacks.
meanings.sent4: The economic crisis despoiled the nation of its prosperity.
meanings.sent5: The invaders despoiled the land of its resources.

meanings.sent1: The despoiled fruit was no longer edible.
meanings.sent2: The despoiled painting was beyond repair.
meanings.sent3: The despoiled surprise party was a total disaster.
meanings.sent4: The despoiled plans left everyone disappointed.
meanings.sent5: The despoiled book had torn pages and missing chapters.
